required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Different Parameters on Extubation Time After Cardiac Surgery.
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Different Parameters on Extubation Time After Cardiac Surgery.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine which factors could be at risk of delayed extubation after cardiac surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine which factors could be at risk of delayed extubation after cardiac surgery. Several parameters of ventilation and infusion were recorded during surgery. A statistical analysis will be performed to determine if one of many of these are significant. The investigator does not assign specific interventions to the study participants, so the present study is observational and not interventional.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patient at risk for OSA scheduled for Cardiac surgery
arm_group.description: Patients with a positive STOP-Bang and DES-OSA score (that means patients at risk for OSA)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patient not at risk for OSA scheduled for Cardiac surgery
arm_group.description: Patients with a negative STOP-Bang and DES-OSA score (that means patients not at risk for OSA)

intervention.description: Time between intubation in the operating room and exhumation in the Intensive Care Unit.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patient at risk for OSA scheduled for Cardiac surgery
Patient not at risk for OSA scheduled for Cardiac surgery

intervention.description: Evolution of the renal function in the next two days
intervention.arm_group_label: Patient at risk for OSA scheduled for Cardiac surgery
Patient not at risk for OSA scheduled for Cardiac surgery

study_pop.textblock: All patients scheduled for cardiac surgery in the Saint-Luc Bouge hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients for elective cardiac surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergency procedures

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Eric DEFLANDRE, MD, PhD, FCCP, FAHA
